result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Joseph Bearheart

defendant.name: Bearheart, Robert Joseph
defendant.address: 246 S Ave W, Clear Lake, WI 54005

records.addlTxt: Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.

1:06 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Robert Joseph Bearheart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Robert Joseph Bearheart.  Prosecuting attorney David Stilin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Does not qualify. Application for ct appt'd counsel sent to jail w/bond. Reading waived. State requests $1,500.00 cash bond. CT sets bond. 1:13 pm adj.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
